title: Requires disclosure of ingredients in fast foods
summary: Adds a new article 30-B to the general business law entitled fast food restaurants; requires fast food restaurants, upon request, to disclose ingredients and nutritional information in foods sold; provides that a sign must be posted to notify customers of their right to this information; creates a civil penalty of not less than $50 or not more than $250 for each violation of this article.

         in fast food restaurants

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The general business law is amended by adding a new article
    2  30-B to read as follows:
    3                                ARTICLE 30-B
    4                            FAST FOOD RESTAURANTS
    5  SECTION  645. DISCLOSURE OF FOOD INGREDIENTS AND NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION
    6                 BY FAST FOOD RESTAURANTS.
    7    S 645. DISCLOSURE OF FOOD INGREDIENTS AND NUTRITIONAL  INFORMATION  BY
    8  FAST  FOOD  RESTAURANTS.  1. AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE, "FAST FOOD RESTAU-
    9  RANT" MEANS ANY FRANCHISED OUTLET OF A  RESTAURANT  CHAIN  THAT  DERIVES
   10  THIRTY  PERCENT OR MORE OF ITS BUSINESS FROM THE SALE OF PREPARED, READY
   11  TO EAT FOOD, WHICH IS SERVED IN A CONTAINER OR WRAPPER AND  IS  CONSUMED
   12  ON THE PREMISES.
   13    2.  UPON  REQUEST,  A FAST FOOD RESTAURANT SHALL MAKE AVAILABLE AT THE
   14  RESTAURANT THE DISCLOSURE OF THE INGREDIENTS  AND  NUTRITIONAL  INFORMA-
   15  TION,  INCLUDING  ITEMS  USED  IN PREPARATION, OF EACH AND EVERY ITEM OF
   16  FOOD OFFERED FOR SALE AT THE RESTAURANT TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:
   17    (A) THE COMMON OR USUAL NAME OF THE FOOD OR BEVERAGE;
   18    (B) THE NAMES OF THE SPECIFIC INGREDIENTS;
   19    (C) EACH INDIVIDUAL FAT AND/OR OIL INGREDIENT OF A FOOD BY ITS SPECIF-
   20  IC COMMON OR USUAL NAME;
   21    (D) ALL NUTRIENT QUANTITIES (INCLUDING VITAMINS,  MINERALS,  CALORIES,
   22  PROTEIN,  CARBOHYDRATE,  FAT, SODIUM AND POTASSIUM) SHALL BE DECLARED IN
   23  RELATION TO THE AVERAGE OR USUAL SERVING; AND

    1    (E) THE NAMES OF THE SPECIFIC SPICES, ARTIFICIAL  FLAVORINGS,  ARTIFI-
    2  CIAL COLORINGS AND CHEMICAL PRESERVATIVES.
    3    3.  ALL  FAST FOOD RESTAURANTS SHALL PERMANENTLY POST IN A CONSPICUOUS
    4  PLACE, A SIGN UPON WHICH THERE  SHALL  BE  IMPRINTED  IN  NO  LESS  THAN
    5  FIFTY-POINT BOLD TYPE THE FOLLOWING NOTICE:
    6    "UPON REQUEST YOU HAVE THE RIGHT TO OBTAIN A LIST OF THE
    7    INGREDIENTS OF FOOD OFFERED FOR SALE AT THIS RESTAURANT"
    8    4.  A  VIOLATION  OF SUBDIVISION TWO OR THREE OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE
    9  PUNISHABLE BY A CIVIL PENALTY OF NOT LESS THAN FIFTY DOLLARS OR NOT MORE

   11    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of January next  succeed-
   12  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
